title: Short Fiction
author: Vsevolod Garshin
summary: A collection of Garshin’s translated short stories and novellas ordered by date of publication.

title: Catriona
author: Robert Louis Stevenson
summary: After coming into his fortune and evading his uncle’s schemes, young gentleman David Balfour continues his adventures in 18th century Scotland, helping a politically unwelcome friend escape into France, avoiding the hangman himself, finding his place as a gentleman in Edinburgh society, and falling in love with the daughter of a notorious Macgregor clansman.

title: Struggles and Triumphs
author: P. T. Barnum
summary: The world’s greatest showman tells the story of his life.

title: Tombstone
author: Walter Noble Burns
summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

title: The Secret of the Old Mill
author: Franklin W. Dixon
summary: The police are out of their depth as counterfeit bills circulate through the city, but two amateur sleuths are on the case.

title: Psmith, Journalist
author: P. G. Wodehouse
summary: Psmith, visiting New York with Mike on a cricket tour, finds entertainment and trouble for himself in the newspaper business, stirring up trouble with New York’s notorious gangs.

title: Oedipus at Colonus
author: Sophocles
summary: A prophecy is fulfilled when an exiled king dies, providing protection to Athens.

title: The Story of the Amulet
author: E. Nesbit
summary: Four children are reunited with an ancient, magical creature and go on adventures through time with a magic amulet.

title: I Will Repay
author: Baroness Orczy
summary: A young woman pursues revenge against the man who killed her brother in a duel years before.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
summary: An ancient undead monster terrorizes Victorian London.

title: My Disillusionment in Russia
author: Emma Goldman
summary: Emma Goldman recounts her experiences living in the early Soviet Union.

title: The D’Arblay Mystery
author: R. Austin Freeman
summary: A doctor finds himself entangled in the mysterious death of an artist after discovering his body in a secluded pond.

title: Red Dusk and the Morrow
author: Paul Dukes
summary: A newly-minted secret agent is sent to pick up the pieces of Britain’s spy networks after they are shattered by the Red Terror.

title: Unto This Last
author: John Ruskin
summary: A philosophical discussion on the nature of wealth and labor.

title: The Iliad
author: Homer
summary: The epic poem which follows a Greek warrior who refuses to give up his prize of war.

title: Main Street
author: Sinclair Lewis
summary: An ambitious young woman chafes against the constraints of small-town America.

title: The Big Time
author: Fritz Leiber
summary: A motley collection of servicemembers escape a plot as two mysterious factions wage an epic war across time itself.

title: Short Fiction
author: Philip K. Dick
summary: A collection of short works by science fiction legend Philip K. Dick.

title: The Everlasting Man
author: G. K. Chesterton
summary: G. K. Chesterton takes us through the history of man, rebuking common secular views and presenting the case for the Catholic Church.

title: The Innocents Abroad
author: Mark Twain
summary: Mark Twain travels abroad, offering witty observations on the places and cultures he encounters and commentary on the habits and foibles of his fellow travelers.
